qas.question: In what year was the death penalty suspended in the US?
What Supreme Court case resulted in capital punishment being suspended?
What amendment to the United States Constitution forbids cruel and unusual punishment?
In what year was the suspension of the death penalty in the United States ended?
In what year was the death penalty allowed in the US?
What Supreme Court case resulted in capital punishment being allowed?
What amendment to the United States Constitution allows cruel and unusual punishment?
In what year was the suspension of the death penalty in South America ended?

context: Capital punishment was suspended in the United States from <a0_0><b5_0>1972<b5_0/><a0_0/> through <a4_0><b9_0>1976<b9_0/><a4_0/> primarily as a result of the Supreme Court's decision in <a1_0><b6_0>Furman v. Georgia<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The last pre-Furman execution was that of <a2_0><b7_0>Luis Monge<b7_0/><a2_0/> on June 2, 1967. In this case, the court found that the death penalty was being imposed in an unconstitutional manner, on the grounds of cruel and unusual punishment in violation of the <a3_0><b8_0>Eighth<b8_0/><a3_0/> Amendment to the United States Constitution. The Supreme Court has never ruled the death penalty to be per se unconstitutional.
